geo_facts.usa_russia_distance: The closest point between the US and Russia is less than 4km apart (Diomede Islands).
geo_facts.freshwater_antarctica: Antarctica holds 72% of the world's available fresh water in its glaciers.
geo_facts.india_diversity: India is the only country with indigenous populations of Caucasian, Negroid, and Mongoloid races.
geo_facts.shanghai_kashgar: The distance from Shanghai to Kashgar is roughly the same as from Kashgar to Stockholm, Sweden.
geo_facts.china_finland: There is only one country separating China and Finland: Russia.
geo_facts.usa_east_west: The USA is technically both the westernmost and easternmost country in the world (crossing the 180th meridian).
geo_facts.largest_desert: The largest desert in the world is actually Antarctica.
geo_facts.poland_north_korea: Technically, only one country separates Poland and North Korea: Russia.
geo_facts.netherlands_sea_level: 60% of the Dutch population lives below sea level.
geo_facts.british_museum: Only about 1% of the British Museum's vast collection is on display to the public.
geo_facts.bulgaria_oldest: Bulgaria is the oldest country in Europe that hasn't changed its name since 681 AD.
geo_facts.highest_toilet: Europe's highest toilet is located on Mont Blanc at an altitude of 4,200 meters.
geo_facts.disneyland_paris: The most visited tourist attraction in Europe is Disneyland Paris.
geo_facts.milan_water_city: Milan, Italy, was once a thriving 'water city' with a network of canals like Venice.
geo_facts.monaco_central_park: Monaco is smaller in size than Central Park in New York City.
geo_facts.london_escalators: The escalators in the London Underground travel the equivalent of twice around the world every week.
geo_facts.france_timezones: France covers 12 time zones, more than any other country in the world.
geo_facts.istanbul_continents: Istanbul is the only major city located across two continents: Europe and Asia.
geo_facts.oldest_zoo: The world's oldest zoo is the Tiergarten Sch√∂nbrunn in Vienna (founded in 1752).
geo_facts.austria_neighbors: Austria is known as the 'Heart of Europe', surrounded by eight different countries.
geo_facts.deepest_canyon: Deepest Canyon: The Yarlung Tsangpo Grand Canyon in Tibet reaches a depth of 6,009 meters.
geo_facts.windiest_place: Windiest place: Antarctica (average wind speed 19.4 m/s).
